results.title: Until you break
results.brief_description: Elliot Spencer has exceptional music video skills as well as a distinctive visual style. In this piece he explores the notions of masculinity, community dynamics and success & achievement in a dangerous sport.

group_siblings.title: Everything was perfect and then I went insane

results.title: Until the end of the world
results.creator_credit: Kim Vecara, Village Roadshow Pictures, Road Movies Filmproduktion, Argos Films and Wim Wenders
results.brief_description: Wim Wenders combines his many obsessions in this bizarre and intricate science-fiction tale spanning three continents. An outstanding Solveig Dommartin plays a woman who is searching for a stranger (William Hurt) to whom she is attracted. All she knows is that he is undertaking a dangerous mission for his scientist father (Max Von Sydow). Her search takes her through an end-of-the millineum Europe and Asia in which technology and consumerism has run riot. She traces the stranger to Australia where beneath the desert soil, a group of Aborigine and European scientists are hoping to create a society which will save mankind. Combining exceptional graphics, a film noir palette and a metaphysical reflection on alienation and colonial exploitation, “Until The End of the World” is a difficult but exhilerating film. Co-starring Jeanne Moreau and Ernie Dingo and featuring a stunning soundtrack including U2, Lou Reed, Nick Cave, Neneh Cherry, Can and REM.

results.title: Until she talks
results.brief_description: Although Judith Ashe has not been accused of any crime, she is in jail. She has not been tried and refuses to testify before a federal grand jury. She is in jail until she talks. The film reveals the legal process that put her there, and the increasing test of her convictions, not only in the grand jury room, but in her relationships with friends, family and her lawyer. Cast: Pamela Reed.

results.title: Unstructured for a summer
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, ONF | NFB and Shelagh Mackenzie
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1968 a group of high-school students from Quebec and Ontario worked on a filmmaking project with the help of the National Film Board. The students discuss their reactions and evaluations of the project.

results.title: Unstable elements
results.creator_credit: Newsreel Collective, Gillian Slovo, Andy Metcalf and Paul Morrison
results.brief_description: Using revealing interviews with prominent scientists, and extraordinary newsreels from the 1940s and 1950s, “Unstable Elements” traces the history of nuclear Britain. Combining several stories in one film, this film also examines - through its fictional part - the way the tunnel vision of the atomic scientists is reflected in family life. A film for a wide audience.

results.title: Unself portrait
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work is an experimental work/abstract narrative on the notion of self, or the lack of a self identity, as a human figure tries to understand who he is.

results.title: Unseen worlds: imaging from atoms to outer space
results.creator_credit: Steve Eder, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Examines a wide range of imaging techniques and their many and varied applications, such as anthropologists using computer technology to probe the remains of Egyptian mummies to discover previously unknown facts about the health and life-style of these people, or doctors using magnetic imaging to view the brain and other organs to provide treatment without resorting to invasive techniques like exploratory surgery.
results.title_for_label: Unseen worlds: imaging from atoms to outer space

results.title: Unseen horizons
results.creator_credit: Terry Ashwood, Associated British-Pathe and Bernard Till
results.brief_description: A complete primary, secondary and specialised vocational educational system for the blind is maintained in Great Britain by the Royal National Institute for the Blind. All types of schools provided are shown.
